Definition at line 13 of file DragEvent.h.

Member Enumeration Documentation

anonymous enum

Action constant returned by getAction(): Signals the start of a drag and drop operation.

The widget should return 

 true

from its onDragEvent() handler method or OnDragListener.onDrag() listener if it can accept a drop. A widget only receives further drag events if it returns 

 true

in response to ACTION_DRAG_STARTED.

See also:
ACTION_DRAG_ENDED
Enumerator:
ACTION_DRAG_STARTED 

Definition at line 30 of file DragEvent.h.

anonymous enum

Action constant returned by getAction(): Sent to a widget after ACTION_DRAG_ENTERED if the drag shadow is still within the widget object's bounding box.

The getX() and getY() methods supply the X and Y position of of the drag point within the widget object's bounding box.

A widget receives an ACTION_DRAG_ENTERED event before receiving any ACTION_DRAG_LOCATION events.

The system stops sending ACTION_DRAG_LOCATION events to a widget once the user moves the drag shadow out of the widget object's bounding box. If the user moves the drag shadow back into the widget object's bounding box, the widget receives an ACTION_DRAG_ENTERED again before receiving any more ACTION_DRAG_LOCATION events.

See also:
ACTION_DRAG_ENTERED
getX()
getY()
Enumerator:
ACTION_DRAG_LOCATION 

Definition at line 51 of file DragEvent.h.

anonymous enum

Action constant returned by getAction(): Signals to a widget that the user has released the drag shadow, and the drag point is within the bounding box of the widget.

The widget should return 

 true

from its Widget#onDragEvent(DragEvent) handler or OnDragListener.onDrag() listener if it accepted the drop, and 

 false

if it ignored the drop.

The widget can also react to this action by changing its appearance.

See also:
#getClipData()
getX()
getY()
Enumerator:
ACTION_DROP 

Definition at line 68 of file DragEvent.h.

anonymous enum

Action constant returned by getAction(): Signals to a Widget that the drag and drop operation has concluded.

A widget that changed its appearance during the operation should return to its usual drawing state in response to this event.

All widgets that received an ACTION_DRAG_STARTED event will receive the ACTION_DRAG_ENDED event even if they are not currently visible when the drag ends.

The widget object can call getResult() to see the result of the operation. If a widget returned 

 true

in response to ACTION_DROP, then getResult() returns 

 true

, otherwise it returns 

 false

.

See also:
ACTION_DRAG_STARTED
getResult()
Enumerator:
ACTION_DRAG_ENDED 

Definition at line 86 of file DragEvent.h.

anonymous enum

Action constant returned by getAction(): Signals to a widget that the drag point has entered the bounding box of the widget.

If the widget can accept a drop, it can react to ACTION_DRAG_ENTERED by changing its appearance in a way that tells the user that the widget is the current drop target. The system stops sending ACTION_DRAG_LOCATION events to a widget once the user moves the drag shadow out of the widget object's bounding box. If the user moves the drag shadow back into the widget object's bounding box, the widget receives an ACTION_DRAG_ENTERED again before receiving any more ACTION_DRAG_LOCATION events.

See also:
ACTION_DRAG_ENTERED
ACTION_DRAG_LOCATION
Enumerator:
ACTION_DRAG_ENTERED 

Definition at line 104 of file DragEvent.h.

anonymous enum

Action constant returned by getAction(): Signals that the user has moved the drag shadow outside the bounding box of the widget.

The widget can react by changing its appearance in a way that tells the user that widget is no longer the immediate drop target.

After the system sends an ACTION_DRAG_EXITED event to the widget, the widget receives no more ACTION_DRAG_LOCATION events until the user drags the drag shadow back over the widget.

Enumerator:
ACTION_DRAG_EXITED
